website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe kettle from a well-respected company. The very best money can buy.
pros: Offers unmatched performance and a large, smart menu of convenient features
Durable, easy to use, and trustworthy
cons: On the more expensive side, but well worth the investment

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart guarantee is worthless
customer_reviews.text: We have loved this electric water kettle, until it just went belly up a year and a half after buying it. You'd think that a Cuisinart product would last better than this. So sad. UPDATE: Since this kettle was under warranty, I applied for a replacement with Cuisinart. It has now been over two months of submitting documents and phone calls and I have yet received my replacement unit. I, for one, cannot recommend buying Cuisinart appliances as they do NOT HONOR their guarantees.
customer_reviews.author: Marti

customer_reviews.title: Defective kettle and useless warranty
customer_reviews.text: Electric Kettle stopped working after 5 month. Cuisinart offered to replace it under their warranty, but I have to pay for shipping both ways ($15 for one way shipping) and wait 7 to 8 business days for replacement to be shipped. Why should I pay $30 and wait so long for a defective product replacement? Low quality product and useless warranty.
customer_reviews.author: GA

customer_reviews.title: They use REFURBISHED PARTS and pack the product inadequatly.
customer_reviews.text: The online description said nothing about using refurbished parts. However the product I received had refurbished "genuine Cuisinart parts". Among other things, that meant it has only a 90 day warranty. It is dishonest to describe a product as new and send one with refurbished parts. There was no protective bubble or other material inside either the outer box nor inside the inner box. The inner box has a dent in it. Do not buy this product online.
customer_reviews.author: CMOK

customer_reviews.title: Pop-up Lid Fails
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the CPK-17 in August 2014. Loved it until Jan 2017 when the pop-up lid stopped popping up; had to use a fingernail to lift it fully. Because it was still under the 3-year warranty, Cuisinart replaced it no questions asked. Now, 19 months later, the pop-up lid suddenly is locked in a closed position. No matter what, it will not open. Just called Cuisinart about it only to learn that the 3-year warranty is based on the original purchase. In other words, I'm out of luck. Decided not to risk going through all of this again and just ordered the Hamilton Beach, which is priced considerably lower anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Champion

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what you've got til it's gone
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how much I really liked this kettle until I thought it died. I immediately searched my order history to buy it again, if it was still possible. Turns out I purchased it Oct 2010. I figured that seemed like a good long life, longer than my computers, so I quickly ordered another one. Then I found I had unwittingly pushed a test button on my electric outlet so it wasn't truly dead. I decided not to cancel my current order because I want another one on hand when this one does die because it is a FANTASTIC kettle! Best I have used. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L. Sweeting

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after 6 months of use!!
customer_reviews.text: I splurged for the expensive Cuisinart brand over the $19.99 Hamilton and regret it. We bought this kettle in May and it began leaking in October. I woke up to water all over my counter and damaged items out on the counter that were soaked and ruined. I have emailed Cuisinart with no reply. Now I’m relacing it with a Hamilton kettle, which I should have chosen to begin with. I was being snobby and thought the expensive Cuisinart model looked sharper. This has a design flaw and Cuisinart should not keep selling it. Believe the reviews and choose a different brand electric kettle. I loved it and it worked great.. until it didn’t. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thran

customer_reviews.title: Great until it starts leaking
customer_reviews.text: This kettle does the job. I was happy with it so I got another one. The problems started as soon as it ran out of warranty - is starts to leak and the leaking gets worse with time until it becomes a safety issue. I contacted the company (Conair) and they refused to take action on account of the product being out of warranty. After I got burned by hot water leaking, I stopped using it and ordered another kettle from a different company. I will not be buying a cuisinart again.
customer_reviews.author: Han Sulu

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and used it infrequently. With that in mind, I was shocked when it stopped working altogether. Searching online, I was able to trace the problem with a faulty relay. Given that it's out of warranty, I ordered the part myself and it's time to do some DIY fixing. With that said, while I wait for the relay, I will need to purchase a different item because I don't want to give money to a company which seems to have frequent quality issues, and uses very cheap parts (the relays should be rated for 20M actuations, and believe me, I haven't used it 20 million times since I purchased it).
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a stovetop kettle, for a faster boil. After about 1-2 months the kid piece broke off (this kettle stays in one place unless it’s being filled with water, or pouring water, never once fell), that piece wouldn’t go back on. The kettle still worked, but we couldn’t open the lid for fear that we would lose the mecanisms that kept the lid shut. Well today, almost one year after purchasing, the kettle stopped working, it won’t heat water, and it just beeps at you.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: The outside will burn you after use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Black and Decker one of these things for many years. When I used this for the first time, the immediate thing I found out was that the outside was extremely hot, as opposed to the Black and Decker. For this reason only, I'm rating this a ONE and I wish I hadn't have gotten it. Not to mention that it's obvious the lettering on the handle will eventually rub off, as many people have reported. But it's the hotness of the outside that I think is a safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Marlowe

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a little over 3 years, may it rest in peace
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it worked, we are avid tea makers at home and this runs at least once a day! Sadly it finally gave its life yesterday after 3 plus years of service, hesitant to invest in another one, hopefully they make a more durable model.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Button to open lid is stuck, now lid won't close.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this kettle, boiled water quickly and provided pretty accurate water temp for my tea. I was surprised after just 2 months when the button to open the lid became stuck when depressed. Now the lid will not stay closed. Very disappointing for a Cuisinart product. I'm now holding for the manufacturer and will update this when I know how they will handle this.
customer_reviews.author: steves

customer_reviews.title: After a week it started to STINK and gunk swelled up inside on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it was thoroughly cleaned, multiple times. About a week or so after use some really odd smelling gunk started to swell up in the seam at the very bottom of the pot (inside) and I tried to clean it using vinegar and whatever it was started to disintegrate and was so nasty and toxic smelling I threw it out. Which really sucks... because we bought one and used it for about 2 years until it started to make really loud popping sounds - which was why we replaced it with another one. Not going to do that again.
customer_reviews.author: Anoni

customer_reviews.title: *You had one Job* - major fail.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a $20 Hamilton Beach for the office and this stainless steel shiny beauty for my home. Guess which one still works and guess which one died after just a couple months? Hint: The one that still works doesn't in any way resemble this stainless steel paperweight and it cost 1/4 less. The Cusinart Doesn't heat water anymore. *You had one Job* - a major bust Cuisnart. For $100 it should probably work. Even for a year. I contacted support but you have to pay to return it and pay to ship it and I could get two of the cheap-o models. Last time for Cuisnart for this guy. Fool me once...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Collins

customer_reviews.title: Worst product
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked on and off. i tried contacting the support but worst customer support. no call back , just waiting . i was out of the return policy time.. it would not heat up, sometimes it worked sometimes it would not. Just piece of junk. Cleaning this is nightmare, opening too small for even smaller hands. I usually do not write reviews but this one deserves it
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I bought. Guess it's the last. This one lasted 6 months and the bottom started leaking. The previous one just quit working. Lit up but wouldn't boil. This time the bottom seal is apparently blown. I'm disgusted. Cuisinart should be better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Galer B. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cattle in March of 2012, it now began slightly leaking at the bottom of the plastic water level window, I’m still able to use it but began looking for eventual replacement. After quite a bit of research I’m back to this one as my #1 choice for looks, utility and overall performance. Although pricey comparing to other models, considering it lasted over 8 years, it is a good investment. I hope the model improved since 2012 and the start and open markings are more lasting, it nicely matches my espresso machine, so I will be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle, didn't last more than 6 years
customer_reviews.text: We loved this kettle, it looks sleek on the countertop and functioned well. After about a year of daily use, the temperature labels had rubbed off, which wasn't a huge problem as we had mostly memorized our favorite buttons. After a little over 6 years, water started to leak out of the bottle of the kettle unto the heating pad. Unfortunately, we are out of warranty, customer service has been poor in response time and resolution. It took 5 weeks, three emails and two phone calls to finally be told they will not honor a replacement but offered us 20% off a new kettle. We won't purchase again as the higher price tag didn't convert to better quality :(
customer_reviews.author: Alaina K.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly accurate
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of the accuracy of this since there's no circulator. But I guess the water bubbling in there does a good enough job circulating the temperature. Anyway I measured the temperature at each setting and found them all within 3F of their targets. And since I always measured a temperature lower the setpoint temperature, I think it was mostly because some heat was lost when I was pouring out of the kettle into my measurement vessel (AKA my fancy name for a water bottle).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart does not stand behind their products
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great kettle for the last 3 yrs. Unfortunately, it now no longer heats up water. I checked with Cuisinart to see how to fix or replace it, and they were kind enough to let me know that the warranty is only good for 3 yrs. The fact that it broke shortly after that time period is up doesn't matter to them, and they have only offered me a slight discount off of a new one. I spent $100 bucks on an electric kettle. I expect to get more than three years out of it. I am going to stop purchasing Cuisinart products at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McHarg

customer_reviews.title: A few problems with this kettle
customer_reviews.text: The first problem with this kettle is that it is hard to clean out. The opening is small and doesn't allow for one to really clean it out. After a couple of years it would occasionally fail to shut off. This causes it to be chucked into the trash as one doesn't need to have one's house burn down because of such a problem. Compared to cheaper models it doesn't perform better. This kettle was used often, and though it has all sorts of nifty buttons and looks good, being stainless steel, I'm going to buy a different kettle that is easier to clean and simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Jane T.

customer_reviews.title: After 5 years of every day use, it stop working... it was about time!!! UPDATE JUN 2019
customer_reviews.text: Loved it and will buy it again. We heat water to drink “mate” twice a day every single day also tea every night before bed. This kettle lasted for 5 years and 4 months! Can’t ask for a better kettle. Accurate temperatures is what we loved the most not to mention the design. UPDATE JUNE 2019 after buying the second one: lid doesn't close and is hard to open it. Will return it. UPDATED: order a new one and is perfectly working!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for longevity
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit since my wife likes it. The first one survived for a year. Its scale window became unreadable within 2 months, then the cap broke. It still worked about 14 months. I can see that the scale window on the second unit is having the same problem. On the other hand, being able to control specific temperature for different tea types is a big plus. The feature to hold the temperature is also very useful.
customer_reviews.author: BostonEngineer

customer_reviews.title: water tasted toxic.  lots of plastic in contact with the water.
customer_reviews.text: had to return it. ran a couple loads of water through it, and it still made my coffee have a distinct chemical taste. maybe it would wash out eventually, but i'd always be thinking that small amounts of something is leeching into my water. i'm not sure if it was the plastic or not, but this kettle does have a lot of plastic in contact with the water, including the window near the handle, an insert in the spout, and the bottom of the lid (water condenses and drips off the top.) on the plus side, i measured the water temperature with a thermometer, and the kettle was very accurate - within 2F of the set temperature.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: This is the One
customer_reviews.text: Look, you're only going to buy one of these once or twice during your lifetime (this one replaces the one a tenant put on an electric stove and melted). It has a good capacity (1.7 liters, or slightly more), heats very quickly, gives you a choice of target temperatures, and holds your temp for a half hour. You can, however, easily set a low temp without thinking, and the "keep warm" setting probably wastes a little more energy than you wish (you can turn it off, but you have to do that each time) keeping the water at temperature. Easy to fill, easy to clean, fast way to heat water.
customer_reviews.author: John Maliga

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a mere 3 years
customer_reviews.text: While the temperature setting mechanism was very handy, the re-boil feature on this kettle was very annoying and bad for the planet. Most seriously, the darn thing only lasted 3 years. My previous English kettle lasted 10.
customer_reviews.author: S. Coldsmith

customer_reviews.title: An essential kitchen tool but the newer model is cheaper construction
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most essential tools in our kitchen. We use it for coffee (french press) every morning and it boils water faster than the microwave. To clean in areas with hard water, simply put an ounce or two of citric acid and fill with water, set to boil and let sit for 15-20 minutes, rinse thoroughly with hot water. This is so useful we bought a second one to use when the first one stops working. Beware though, as the newer one is not as good as this older one. They cheapened the new one (we returned it) and the replacement they sent we use as backup was thankfully one of the old models.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. + Mrs. GMO

customer_reviews.title: Get the right temperature
customer_reviews.text: I am a tea drinker – a soup sipper and a “I want hot water” yesterday kind a guy. And this product fills all those needs. Not a day goes by when I don’t use my Cuisinart CPK- which means it’s durability & has truly been tested. I cannot believe how much I’ve grown to rely on this product Of convenience. However the problem with this product - is the development of the snooty factor -whenever someone makes you a cuppa tea and they have not used a temperature setting teapot, you will have to be quietly, graciously offended by the fact that it’s not the right temperature for the type of tea you’re having.
customer_reviews.author: MeanDaddy

customer_reviews.title: even better than previous version!
customer_reviews.text: omg!! I loved my previous one of these, which I bought several years ago and still works (I moved it to another location). But this one is so much quieter!!, and seems to boil water even faster. I am so impressed!! If you're comparing with other brands, I wasn't sure that the keep warm feature and the temp control would be important, but I actually find these are great. While I don't want to keep water warm all the time, it is helpful sometimes! And temp control is great for making tea for little ones, making tea that I'd like to drink right away, or making green tea etc. that requires a specific temp. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Peabody1

customer_reviews.title: Bought two & both failed in 2yrs ! Don’t buy it !
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and it failed after 18 months. So because I liked it I bought another - that failed after 2yrs. Now I’m done. It’s an expensive kettle and should last longer than that. Clearly it’s got a limited life cycle and is not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years after buying, it is leaking water when used
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is great, lots of options, nice look to it on the counter. But just before the 2 year mark, it is already leaking all over when used. It doesn't really drain what's in the container, but at least a few tablespoons of water end up on the base and around the base. I'll be submitting a warranty claim, but I'm guessing I'll end up paying about the price of a new kettle just to ship it to the repair center and back.
customer_reviews.author: ushamz

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year before it began tripping circuit breakers
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it zero stars if that were an option. Unfortunately, just around the year mark it would trip circuit breakers. Initially I assumed it was a wiring issue in our home. Nope, it was the kettle. It was lightly used and well maintained. If you do decide to risk it, purchase insurance.
customer_reviews.author: adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Good kettle with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Looked at many options before purchasing an electric kettle, and this one seemed the best contender. First one was defective, buttons didn’t work, but the replacement has been working fine and we are enjoying it. Gripes: the top opening is too narrow to get your hand into, making it impossible to clean. The fill window is behind the handle, so you can’t see the water level as you are filling the kettle! Lastly, the water level markings are in liters, making it useless if you want say, a cup of boiling water while cooking. We are a family of tea drinkers, and speedy heating and keep warm function have been great.
customer_reviews.author: sonic mom

customer_reviews.title: not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: first of all, the description says stainless steel but the box you get says stainless steel trim or lined or something to that effect. the part that touches your water...you know...the part you should care about....its magnetic so it is not stainless steel. personally i want to know what could be leaching into my hot beverage i drink daily. i have no idea what this is but its not stainless. ( and even some stainless contains nickel and cadmium so even if it is stainless don't totally let your guard down. learned that while researching this pot)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Default Keep Warm setting is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Love this kettle. We use it all day long for tea and coffee at our preferred temperatures. No more adding ice cubes to cool down boiling water. Not really sure why it needs the Keep Warm function as a small, non commercial kettle - we often accidentally touch it and then have to go back to the kitchen to stop it repeatedly reboiling. The Keep Warm function also seems to be a default setting, so every time we get a power outage it resets to Keep Warm. Other than that annoyance, it’s a great kettle.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: No more keurig for me.
customer_reviews.text: The Keurig 2.0 was such a disaster, I herd it for the entire year I owned it. Then I was housesitting for a friend who had this wonderous piece of technology. I’ll never go back. That thing was donated in all it’s messy noisy glory. This is the BEST thing I’ve ever owned. I can make tea just as quick and with more, less messy options. And it’s perfect to pair with my French press when I want coffee. The exact temps make it the absolute best possible of speed efficiency and flavor. Brava. Don’t come for my kettle. She’s alllll mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Best selection of temp controls
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my old T-fal variable temp tea pot and is a huge improvement, with a couple of qualifications. It is not easy to get my hand into when I might want to wash it. I already see two tiny rust spots inside after only a few weeks of use (I am watching them.) And it cannot be emptied completely without spilling over the sides of the spout, making a potentially dangerous mess with very hot water. However, the temp controls are the bomb! I am a heavy and snobby tea drinker. To have a setting for oolong and delicate greens in addition to all the other settings is awesome! I hope the quality proves out.
customer_reviews.author: Sheshopsonline

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The lid is stuck and can’t be open just after one year of use. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Doudou

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pot in Nov. 2015. After about 9 months of use, the pot started to leak around the lower handle attachment. I contacted Cuisinart and they replaced the entire pot for $15 plus shipping return of the defective pot. The replacement made it about 4 months and it began leaking in the exact same place. I really like the product for accurate and safe heating without monitoring. Several temps to choose from. I am going to cut my losses and not pay for another replacement that may leak in a few months. The pot has "made in China" on the bottom. I seem to have much better experiences with German kitchen products.
customer_reviews.author: Panman

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and confusing
customer_reviews.text: I hate this machine. Its loud, and the water level indictor is hard to see behind the handle. There i's no "off" switch. To turn it off, you push the Start button, which also turns the light on it off. But if you lift up the pot, the light comes on again, so you don't know if its on or off. My wife gets angry, claiming I left it on. I've gone back to heating water in a saucer. Quiet, quick, no lights, no beeps, no arguments.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great item for tea enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kettle to replace a Breville we had for a while. We are tea enthusiasts and we use it primarily to boil water for tea. We love the ability to select the appropriate temperature and the fact that the kettle keeps the water hot for 30 minutes, unless you shut it down, so we can have multiple cups of tea without starting the boiling process over each time. So far we have used it dozens of times with no issues. We bought it partly because consumer reports rated it as number one on their list. It was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Corrado Ghioldi

customer_reviews.title: Heats water fast, some design changes would make it better, needs wifi connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle! This was a game changer for making pour-over coffee. Without raising the temp too high, I am able to make coffee without burning the grounds. Features I would add/change: The water level viewer should be on the sides of the kettle, not behind the handle. In hindsight I would find an Alexa compatible model to get water heating in the morning as part of a routine. When pouring water out of this, it doesn’t come out of a solid stream, comes out as a disjointed trickle.
customer_reviews.author: mikeg77

customer_reviews.title: Loved it - until it leaked and flooded my counter.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle has great features but today, less than 11 months from purchasing the kettle, I woke up to over a liter of water on my counter. The kettle is leaking near the base, below the handle. Cuisinart’s return shipping policy is not cost effective to replace. It’s a shame, but it’s going into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Unpopularpoet

customer_reviews.title: Solid kettle; 6 temperature ranges
customer_reviews.text: Great water kettle. This is my second one after almost 8 years of daily use from my first one. I love how you can vary the temperature for different types of beverages. Note: when you pour your water after heating, add water back into the kettle as the kettle automatically reheats the water unless you turn it off. I’ve had the water boil out a few times and the kettle just automatically turn off, but good to note for those interested in purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppapolooza

customer_reviews.title: Died after  6 years of light  use
customer_reviews.text: The job of this appliance is simple: boil or heat water. I bought it July 2014, and as of December 2020 it started leaking water onto the (electrified) heating pad, followed shortly thereafter by the controls of the pot, and heating, no longer working. In today's world some may that 6 years of home use is a good lifetime for an item like this. To me it's not just a waste of money, but now this item will betaking up space in a garbage landfill because it cannot be recycled. Just say No to Cuisinart, it's just a brand name now, not quality.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Shop around
customer_reviews.text: I have had different Electric tea pots and loved them. The down fall for this one is the amount of time it takes to warm the water up. I can boil water faster than this tea pot takes. Not worth the money or my time
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Yost

customer_reviews.title: French press setting worth this kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my family member has one and coffee tasted ten times better than mine despite having the same beans, french press and grinder. Turns out the water temperature makes a huge difference. I bought this for the french press setting but this has a lot of functions. One thing I took a star away for is that it is confusing to realize you have to press the setting and start button rather than just the setting button. The light stays on the setting when pressed so it looks like it started. A better feature is to have it auto start after a few seconds. The start button also functions as a stop button.
customer_reviews.author: J.u.Bee

customer_reviews.title: That it burns the hell out of your fingers.
customer_reviews.text: This product is used for making hot water, but it also is for Burning your fingers or hand. When you are buying it, the description fails to tell you that this kettle gets as hot as an Iron and you can burn the hell out of your hands or fingers when you touch the outer body of the kettle accidentally. The manufacturer of this product does not disclose it when you are reading the description and Amazon does not know this either. If you want safety, stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shahnaz M.

customer_reviews.title: Great electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle in June of 2015. Thought I should write a review after all this time. This kettle has been a great little unit. I use it once or twice everyday to make my coffee and tea. The temperature of the water is still within +- 2 degrees of the setting. The only thing so far that I have noticed and I have seen this in other reviews is the lettering is worn off on the center portion of the START button. I guess this makes sense as that is the button used all the time. Overall I am quite happy with this purchase and it has been working for over 5 years now without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: G. Evans

customer_reviews.title: The kettle leaks like a faucet
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this kettle August 3, 2019 29 and initially it worked perfectly and it still does. Heats the water based on the temp selected and keeps it warm. However, in less a year the kettle started leaking profusely. I have to place the kettle on a folded towel to absorb the water daily. I am sorry but based on my experience I would not recommend this kettle to anyone. My first Cuisinart appliance to ever fail me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: very nice performing kettle, but exterior gets really hot - wish I opted for an insulated heater
customer_reviews.text: I like this highly reviewed/rated hot water kettle, but after having used it for a few occasions, I wish i spend more money and got an insulated hot water heater instead. This kettle does everything you need it to do, and does it quickly. However, the kettle is not insulated and gets very hot - definitely a hazard with kids around.
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly and accurately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago when I decided to ditch using pods and just make French press coffee. I have used it everyday sometime two or three times a day in the winter. I haven’t had the issue where the number wear off. So perhaps they solved that problem. The temp settings are accurate and useful if you drink various teas that do better at low temps. It’s one of a few appliances I keep out on my counter because I use it with such frequency. I took off one star for cleaning because the opening is relatively small and has sharp edges. But it’s really not hard to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: RobAbroad

customer_reviews.title: I thought I loved it, but I don't.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on June 1, 2018. By the end of October 2018, the product was "howling". When I turn it on to heat, it begins to make these very loud "singing" or "howling" noises. C'mon. It's almost new. Why is this happening?
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Since working from home, it's so easy for me to start the water on the stove and then get sidetracked by a call or impromptu meeting. I've refilled the pot more times than I've made tea. This kettle is my new best friend! Not only do I get a *beep* when it's done, but if I'm not able to make it back right away, it will keep the temp for me until I do. And then there's the fact that it has buttons for teas/temps other than my go-to black tea/boil option... one less thing I have to Google... like I said, my new best friend! I 100% recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Precise but limited temperature control and not smart.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast and precise electric kettle but I think it would be a time to Cuisinart to update this to the current age. Why limit the temperature control to just buttons when you could have a smartphone app to control the boiler in one-degree steps? Also, it is easy to forget to shut down the boiler when the kettle defaults to the "keep warm" option and heats up when it is empty! It only stops when it overheats and to me, that's a big flaw in the design.
customer_reviews.author: Mikko

customer_reviews.title: Failed and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kettle because of the positive reviews. I was extremely disappointed when it failed out of the box. I did a test boil, except that the lid popped up halfway through it worked fine. For my second pot, before I hit start, I turned off the Keep Warm feature. The pot never heated. I turned the Keep warm feature back on, still a failure. So, my first and last day with this pot, I will return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE - my Cuisinart kettle has stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 2019, and the kettle after four months, has suddenly stopped working at all and I have had no success getting Customer Service on the phone. It is not working in the following way - pressing to heat the water, it takes a moment or so and then starts to beep and its lights flash. No heated water. I have had no success in speaking with any Cuisinart customer service as it involves being put on hold for a long time - I am trying again now and have been on hold for 29 minutes. Very disappointing, particularly when the product functioned fine when first purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Chk

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: The kettle recently stopped heating the water to set temperatures. It only heats the water to lukewarm levels regardless of what temperature you select. It sill looks awesome, but like several other Cuisinart small electrics I've bought in the past. They look great but their reliability is unpredictable. Some times they last a long time and other times they don't. It's a hit or miss. The do make their stuff look expensive though.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Teapot
customer_reviews.text: Handy little teapot. This teapot has a small footprint on the counter making it easy to place almost anywhere. The power station does not get hot making it safe around inattentive people. The teapot bottom also remains cool making it possible to set it on the counter without damage or steady a full teapot. The controls are a little excessive with small print on most of the temperature setting buttons. The manufacturer printed both the type of tea and the temperature each button will heat to. As the teapot heats, the water boiling becomes louder and louder. This can be distracting, but I don't think we can get around the physics of boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: Kris A.

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Easy
customer_reviews.text: We are moving away from microwave use in this household. This cordless electric kettle works beautifully as a replacement for preparing a quick cup of tea. It actually tops the microwave because this kettle allows for different temps for the brewing of different types of teas. We love our teas in this household so this kettle really works quite nicely for us. Haven't used the microwave very much for anything that requires a quick cup or two of boiling water since the kettle arrived.
customer_reviews.author: eimcmullin

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a different brand of electric kettle that started to leak. I've had this one a month or so and so far so good! I like the preset temperature settings. I make both green and herbal tea. I can set it to green, pour that, then up it to boil and wait a few more seconds and pour for the herbal tea. I don't care about having a skinny spout or setting an exact temperature - my old kettle had both of these features and I don't see the advantage. I'm not that picky.
customer_reviews.author: K10 Lee

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had looked at many products similar to this one and I just really liked the look and the reviews of the product so decided to give it a try. I was not disappointed! I love that it had different temperature settings. Like a reviewer said, it is a little noisy for a brief amount of time but I don't find that to be a problem. It heated the water quickly and it is a nice looking pot on my counter so I am a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Murray

customer_reviews.title: I love electric tea kettles
customer_reviews.text: I have had one most of my life, they are the best. I used my last one to death. The screen actually disintegrated and I didn't notice, kinda gross really. I made sure I found a kettle that you could remove the screen, or replace it. I also like being able to control the temp. without having to buy a fancy expensive contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Beloved in our home since August 2016
customer_reviews.text: Beloved in our home since August 2016. Bought a second for my parents, who love it too. We use the temperature settings and are happy with them. We clean it occasionally by boiling vinegar in it. We’re looking to go off grid for a bit and it looks like we’ll need to find an alternative to this, since it’s 1500W to run.
customer_reviews.author: cookie.dough

customer_reviews.title: Love this tea pot
customer_reviews.text: I did some research before purchasing this product. The reviews I read were correct. This tea pot heats water extremely fast. It is loaded with great features. It gives you several heat settings. It will keep your water to temperature for 30 minutes. It is very easy to use and clean. My son thought it was going to be stupid. He thought the stove did a good enough job. Now he uses it more than I do.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make tea with and love how easy it is to use. We make green tea every day and its so simple to brew at the right temperature. So far, about 6 months in, we could not be more pleased and have had 0 issues.
customer_reviews.author: H. Mangiameli

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Great Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It quickly boils water, keeps it at that temperature for a time if I don't get to it right away and is very easy to use and clean. We only use it two or three times as week, but it works really well. It does make a little more noise than a standard kettle while heating, but it's not intrusive or anything. The 1.7L capacity is enough to heat water to make a nice big pitcher of iced tea ... and it only takes a few minutes for it to bring the water to a boil. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a couple years...but beware serious potential safety issues.
customer_reviews.text: I purchases this electric kettle a few years back through a local brick and mortar store. It worked well for about two years but then started to leak internally (likely somewhere around the top of the sight gauge) when filled more than ~2/3 capacity. By "leak" I mean once it begins to boil the water runs into the electric base and all over and down the cabinets. I reported this obvious design flaw and safety hazard to the manufacturer and they responded that they would replace it for about 1/2 what I paid for it. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Nuke

customer_reviews.title: My daughter introduced me to this pot and I love it. This is my second time purchasing it ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter introduced me to this pot and I love it. This is my second time purchasing it as hers died after about 6+ years of continuous use. She wanted the same, exact pot. It looks attractive in the kitchen, is sturdy and has several settings. Besides making americano style coffee and occasional tea, we keep the kettle going when cooking to provide constant hot water for cooking. I treat it with a vinegar solution every few months to get rid of any hard water build up. The finish stays nice with just a wipe down or simple soapy wash if the outside becomes greasy from cooking.
customer_reviews.author: PresPetunia

customer_reviews.title: really good, but...
customer_reviews.text: pros: temp control, sight glass fill indicator, keep warm feature, appearance. cons: vessel gets hot to touch; can't shut it off if overtemp and on base (have to take it off to cool down); balance when holding by handle - can't easily reach 'open' button with thumb, and if you hold it firmly your hand will press on buttons.
customer_reviews.author: numbers  cruncher

customer_reviews.title: not valuable
customer_reviews.text: It takes so long to boil water. Considering it's pricy, I don't think it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JUNG YUP OH

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace a previous unit, which rusted out, and I’m well pleased with the temperature selections offered. It appears the unit takes longer than my old one to heat up, but it keeps the temp well once heated. Also the temperature controll is much easier when switching from coffee at 200F to green tea at 170F with preset buttons. Overall quite satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi-chan

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Does what it's supposed to do, well made.
customer_reviews.text: The controls are straight forward though reading through the manual does help. Like what to do when the water runs low and it's still keeping warm automatically. Worth spending the extra money then the less expensive options. No plastic bits touching the water, easy to clean, ergonomic and love all the options for different kinds of tea/coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Serra

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: First used this at a vacation rental home and ordered one for us before I left! We drink a lot of tea so it used multiple times a day. Heats up quickly, the gauge lets you use only the water you will need and it frees up space on the stove where a tea kettle used to sit. A little pricey but so far, worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: A Nanna

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Performance is Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I replaced another brand that only lasted 14 months with this cuisinart. Love the differant temperature setting. Heats water fast and can keep water warm for some time. The most important aspect for me with any product I buy is the durability of It. This seems to be very well made and performance is excellent. I hope it last some time.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Heat water fast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from a previous kettle, and really like the 6 different temperature settings, and the speed with which it heats the water. The learning curve was in remembering to turn it off after I've filled the teapot, as it will continue to keep the water at the set temperature for 30 minutes, and will then starting reminding you to turn it off!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: I drink a lot of tea now!
customer_reviews.text: I like drinking tea, but I just sort of stopped over the years and I realized it's because it was such a hassle and the whistle of our old teapot gave me anxiety. Enter this lovely little thing, which I originally bought for my boyfriend but am definitely using it all the time myself. I love how I can set the temperature to such a degree that I can drink my tea right away. And it heats up so quickly and just beeps gently when it's done. Love it! The sides do get hot, so be careful there.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: 8 years strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in November of 2011. This gets nearly daily use and is still operating. It has worked flawlessly for just short of 8 years. Recently, I've noticed that it seems to take slightly longer to bring water to a boil, but we just moved, so there might be other factors contributing to this. I would highly recommend this kettle. It has exceeded the lifespan i expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect temperature control
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these we bought. First one went into precautionary quarantine with my son. Perfect temperature control. The first one is still working well after 5+ years, except for the lid unlock - you now have to help it to open. Not a big deal. Heats fast, stable construction, great temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: H. Metz

customer_reviews.title: great while it lasts (which hasn't been long x2)
customer_reviews.text: I received my first kettle as a (requested) gift. I loved the flexiblity of temperature control. It died after two years. I purchased a second in October 2018 and it just stopped working. I run it every few days, do not abuse it. I am open to there being a user error problem, but it is not worth it to me to buy another one. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: smorey

customer_reviews.title: Purchased it a second time.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product enough to give it a second chance as the first one died 3 years and one month after purchase, one month past the warranty. I bought the extended warranty for an additional year this time. I like the various settings and the fact it will keep water warm for a period of time in the event you want a second cup. I drain it at night and if if develops the water stains, I find that a soaking in vinegar and water removes them. Just rinse adequately before reuse. Unlike a kettle on the stove top, I don't have to worry about becoming distracted as I know it will turn off automatically.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Pros-Quality materials and a great look. The ability to heat to different temperatures is key if you like different types of tea or different brews of coffee. The 'keep warm' feature is great if you are sitting around having tea or coffee with company and want more than one cup. Con-The kettle gets extremely hot to the touch. You can burn yourself if you touch it when you have it on the 'boil' setting. This is really the only issue with the unit, otherwise it would be 5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: My water heats fast and to the perfect temperature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I used it at a friend's house and loved it. I hate heating the water for my tea in a microwave and it can take awhile to heat it in a kettle on the stove. Now I get my water fast! But, what I especially like about this is that it heats to the perfect temperature for each different kind of tea! And, it stays at that temperature for a half-hour so that I can relax over breakfast and refill my cup several times, always getting the same mouth flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Kettle! Fast heated water immediately!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant at first when I first used this and didn't think that this kettle would make a difference compared to a regular kettle. This kettle is amazing! It heats up water in minutes! And heats it up to a specific temperature that you select! Great for Tea, Coffee, etc.!
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Best teapot for picky tea drinkers!
customer_reviews.text: I consume different types of teas all of which brew and steep at different temperatures. My Cuisinart CPK-17 does it all. The temperature gauge is right in the handle. The temperature ranges are perfect for all different types of teas ( and coffees too). I have one for home and one in my office. NOTHING beats a properly brewed cup of tea.My CPK-17 does that! Sorry STARBUCKS, I saving money and getting the SAME quality. Richard T. upstate NY Earl Grey fan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COFFEE AND TEA ARE SO FLAVORFUL
customer_reviews.text: Love my Cuisinart PerfectTemp Electric kettle. Bought a cheaper kettle with temperature control and sent it right back because the temperature gauge immediately had moisture. So glad I exchanged the kettle. This one is so sleek and the handle is great. Also so easy to fill with water. Love the temperature memory. I never enjoyed drinking tea because it was tasteless - with the temperature gauge I'm able to brew my jasmine and oolong tea at the right temperature. This was so worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Heats the water perfectly, and much faster than I had expected. It’s pretty convenient to just fill it, select the water temperature based on what you need it for, and walk away doing other things while it takes care of it for you. The outside does get very warm so you have to be careful and only pick up by the handle to avoid the hot metal, but this exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mistabrad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd kettle and I finally got all the features I wanted - it works perfectly - it beeps when done, has a warming feature, the handle pops the lid open easily, it goes all the way to boiling, has lights so you know it's working and what it's doing. GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: lee c paiva

customer_reviews.title: A very good alternative to the expensive Breville kettle.
customer_reviews.text: It’s quite noisy when boiling water and the opening of the kettle is a little small for cleaning but it’s much cheaper than the Breville alternative (which I had one for two years and it broke on me) so it’s worthy to have one and see how long this cuisine art kettle can last for ! Overall very happy with it, temperature controls is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality-Leaking water after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed and extremely disappointed that the kettle started to leak water at the bottom just after 8 months of moderate use. It was never dropped or misused. Beware of the scam running by Cuisinart 3-year product Warranty: if the product failed they require you to pay for shipping back and add $15 for shipping and handling on the top of this. So if your kettle failed in a few month it is still easier and cheaper to through it away. Shame on Cuisinart brand! I will never buy any of its products
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kochman

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric kettle that anyone can own. With the keep warm and no boil features this kettle is a must for anyone who has ever had cold water or burnt up a kettle. The water is boiling regardless of the temperature that you set the kettle at and no need to worry about filling it as the open button makes it easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Stitcherhm

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Kettle!
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to use and I never knew my tea could taste this good (also hot cocoa - it does wonders for mixing that as well). It heats quickly and delivers consistent hot water. I can't wait to get my french press and start drinking coffee using my kettle.
customer_reviews.author: kwirki1

customer_reviews.title: Buy This One
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few different kettles over the years and this is by far the best one. It's been almost one year, so I wanted to write a quick review addressing the lettering durability issue. After reading several complaints that the lettering rubs off, I was sure to always handle the kettle with clean, dry hands. In almost a years worth of daily use, the kettle still looks brand new. No issues with faded lettering. This kettle is quick, accurate and reliable. What else do you need? Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ross L Leleux

customer_reviews.title: Dead in just one month!
customer_reviews.text: It looked very good out of the box. Beautifully crafted stainless steel. However, part of the reasons why I wanted this was the built-in filter. That one didn't work too well. I still needed an external filter on my cups. That was the first blow. Then I overlooked that because I really liked the kettle. But today, it's completely dead. Yep! Stopped working after a month, and I have to go back to using a kettle I bought for 20 bucks or less over 7 years ago! That's a shame. That! instantly strikes out other Cuisinart items I had on my purchase list.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Properly
customer_reviews.text: Intermittent problem: The lights blink on and off constantly, not sure why, can't make it start. If I unplug it, it starts over. Or it used to. But now it won't start over after being unplugged. I just get blinking lights. I'd like to return it, but the window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom in our kitchen and we love it. It is really nice having our water kettle be able to have different temperature settings, and it heats up fast. I love that the kettle also keeps your water at the correct temperature for about 30 minutes I believe. Overall I love this kettle and recommend for anybody in need of one especially if you boil a lot of water.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard of Electric Kettles
customer_reviews.text: Stop. Just stop. Buy this one. That's all you really need to know. Multiple accurate push-button temperature settings, ability to keep warm up to 30 minutes. Large kettle holds 1.7 liters of water to keep the most avid tea drinker hydrated. It is easy to fill, easy to see how much water is left, and attaches/detaches from its base with ease. If you're looking for the best kettle you can get - this is it. The end.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Obelcz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I drink a lot of tea and this kettle allows me to get the correct temperature for my chosen tea type. I just push the button! I use vinegar & water and a bottle brush for easy cleaning. It also holds a decent capacity for making a larger pot of tea but doesn’t take up a ton of space in my tiny kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Waller

customer_reviews.title: makes hot water fast
customer_reviews.text: Compared to less expensive Hot Water Kettles, I like the ability to select the temperature of the water. I've used it daily for a few month, without a heating problem. I did notice that the water did not pour smoothly and determined it was the filter screen, by trying a friend's filter screen in my kettle. I contacted the company and they promptly sent me a replacement screen - problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin123

customer_reviews.title: Best. Kettle. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even know that different types of tea require different temperature water. This kettle is the bomb! I have an electric stove so it takes way too long to boil water. With this kettle, I turn it on and by the time I take a mug out of the cupboard, get a teabag out of the pantry, and walk back to the kettle, it's boiling!
customer_reviews.author: LW_RestonVA

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp 1.7-Liter Stainless Steel Cordless Electric kettle, 1.7 L, Silver
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Electric kettle

THE PERFECTEMP FOR EVERY OCCASION
Equipped with 1500 watts of power for fast heating, this electric kettle brings up to 1-2/3 liters of water to a rolling boil in a matter of minutes. Better than that, it offers six different preset heat settings, which allows for steeping tea at just the right temperature depending on the variety. Using the simple one-touch controls on the kettle's handle, select 160 degrees F for delicate teas, 175 degrees F for green tea, 185 degrees F for white tea, 190 degrees F for oolong tea, 200 degrees F for French press coffee, and "Boil" for black tea or to make instant cocoa, oatmeal, noodles, and more. 

CUISINART CPK-17 PERFECTEMP CORDLESS PROGRAMMABLE KETTLE
The control panel also offers blue LED indicators, a "start" button, and a "keep warm" button, which will maintain the set temperature for 30 minutes. For added convenience, the kettle's 360-degree swivel base allows for pouring without the hassle of a power cord getting in the way, and its memory function makes it possible to remove the kettle from its base for two minutes without it shutting off or losing its place in the heating process. 

Other highlights include a stay-cool nonslip handle, an "open" button for lifting the lid, a blue backlit water window with measurement marks, a concealed heating element to prevent mineral buildup, a removable/washable scale filter, a dripless pour spout, and boil-dry protection with auto shutoff for safety. A user manual with recipes comes included. The kettle measures approximately 8-1/5 by 9-4/5 by 12 inches and carries a three-year limited warranty. 

PARTS AND BENEFITS
 1.  Dripless Pour Spout with Splash Guard
     keeps counters dry
     
     
 2.  Removable Scale Filter
     for clean water
     
     
 3.  Easy-Open Lid
     for quick and easy filling
     
     
 4.  Lid Release Button
     
     
 5.  Preset Temperature Controls with Indicators 
     
      * Delicate (160°F)
      * Green (175°F)
        
      * White (185°F)
        
      * Oolong (190°F)
        
      * Herbal (200°F)
        
      * Black (Boil – 212°F) 
        
      * French Press (200°F) 
        
     
     
     
     
 6.  Start (Stop) with Indicator
     to start/stop the heating process
     
     
 7.  Keep Warm with Indicator
     maintains the selected temperature for 30 minutes
     
     
 8.  Water Window
     for a clear view of water level
     
     
 9.  Stay-Cool Handle
     designed for comfort
     
     
 10. Power Base with 360° Swivel
     for cordless convenience
     
     

PRODUCT OVERVIEW
 * 1.7-liter capacity
 * 6 preset temperatures
 * One-touch controls with blue LED indicators
 * 30-minute Keep Warm option
 * Memory feature allows kettle to be lifted off base for 2 minutes without shutting off or losing its place in the brewing process
 * 1500 watts for fast heat-up
 * Blue backlit water window
 * 360° swivel cordless connector
 * Stay-cool nonslip handle
 * Concealed heating element to prevent mineral buildup
 * Removable/cleanable scale filter
 * Auto shutoff and boil dry protection
 * Limited 3-year warranty

SPECIAL FEATURES
• MEMORY FEATURE
The kettle features an internal “memory” that lets you leave the kettle off the base for up to 2 minutes without it going into standby mode. When returned to the base, it will restart the heating and/or Keep Warm cycles right where they left off.

• KEEP WARM MODE
Keep Warm is the kettle’s default function that automatically maintains selected temperature for 30 minutes. If you have selected the Boil preset, your unit will hold a temperature just below boiling during the Keep Warm cycle. To bring water back to a rolling boil, press the Start button twice. Keep Warm can be turned off by pressing the Keep Warm button at any time before or during the heating cycle. 

• BOIL-DRY PROTECTION
Your kettle is equipped with boil-dry protection. If it starts heating without enough water in the unit, the heater will automatically shut off to avoid damaging the heating element. The lights will flash and the unit will beep to alert you. Once the kettle has cooled down, lift it off the base, then replace it to reset and restart the heating cycle. The quickest way to cool down the heater is to fill the kettle with cold water; however, you can also wait for it to cool down by itself. 

• SLEEP MODE
If the unit is not in use for 5 minutes, it will revert to sleep mode. The heater and all lights will be off, but your last selections will remain in the unit’s memory. To turn the kettle back on, simply press any button, or lift it up and then return it to the base.
